column1: After this many days a log will be deleted. Set to 0 to never auto-delete logs.
column2: After this many days a log will be deleted. Set to 0 to never auto-delete logs.

column1: Authentication password used if you selected an authentication method other than none.

column1: Authentication username used if you selected an authentication method other than none.

column1: Disabling will force the use of the normal Magento mail sending regardless of other settings.
column2: Disabling will force the use of the normal Magento mail sending regardless of other settings.

column1: Disabling will log outgoing e-mail in the log, but will not actually send it
column2: Disabling will log outgoing e-mail in the log, but will not actually send it

column1: Emails listed here will not be sent to, but sending will report as a success. This is useful if some of your customers / subscribers have invalid emails and you want to avoid sending to them.
column2: Emails listed here will not be sent to, but sending will report as a success. This is useful if some of your customers / subscribers have invalid emails and you want to avoid sending to them.

column1: If disabled, mail will use the normal Magento mail sending method.
column2: If disabled, mail will use the normal Magento mail sending method.

column1: If enabled the reply-to will be set if available (such as on the contact form). This is not compatible with all SMTP servers.
column2: If enabled the reply-to will be set if available (such as on the contact form). This is not compatible with all SMTP servers.

column1: If you choose none, then the username and password below will not be used
column2: If you choose none, then the username and password below will not be used
